ratings.comment: Professor Niedorf is great professor because he uses very organized notes, is easily accessible outside of class, and he genuinely cares about his students. If you have to take Math 340, Professor Niedorf is a good choice.

Lars explains the concepts very well and seems to genuinely care whether the students can understand. He provides templates for notes, which makes learning the material easier, and the HW is easy if you don't procrastinate. The tests are a huge portion of your grade, however, and the MCs are usually a bit tricky.

Good professor but a hard class. Lectures get a little boring because unlike most math classes he doesn't ever pause for students to try an example on there own but he is a good teacher. Tests are very hard though, partial credit was strict, and the multiple choice questions weirdly abstract. Lectures are recorded which is nice.

Lars is a good person, always comes to lecture extremely happy. He could have taught a little better though. He would often struggle to answer a question from any student and his lectures get extremely boring.

Lars is a very knowledgable professor and it is clear he is passionate about Math. His lecture style is amazing for first semester freshman coming from high school since he uploads blank and filled in copies of his notes as well as lecture recordings. He is very understandable and is always willing to answer your doubts mid-lecture. Def recommend!!

Nicest guy ever, first time in college where I felt like a professor actually cared about his students. Gave me extensions and checked in on me when I was going through serious sh*t (censored for RMP site standards). He's pretty good for how new he is and provided lecture recordings (if you are like me and fear the stench of CS freshmen).
